pages.text: Pachydiscus is a genus of ammonite from the Late Cretaceous with records in the earliest Paleocene Epoch. This ammonite was quite large, with some species reaching a diameter of 40 cm or more and it had a worldwide distribution. It is one of the few ammonites to have been recorded surviving the K-Pg Extinction event that killed off the dinosaurs, however like all other surviving ammonites it did not survive for long and died out not long after the beginning of the Cenozoic.
